d16afa0ae7c.shortDescription: Mining the tech world for lively, meaningful tales.

paragraphs.name: 93e7
paragraphs.text: By contrast, Pepsi’s ad offers up nothing about what the soda maker believes. And unlike Urban Outfitters, when Pepsi addressed criticism, it didn’t take a stand on police brutality and other political issues consumers raised. Instead, the brand apologized…to Kendall Jenner. Jenner, who has done no better than Pepsi in aligning her personal brand with a set of values, is reportedly in Paris recovering from the trauma of her big miss by avoiding social media. It’s a vacuous move that won’t soon be forgotten — if only because the memes are endless.

Last week, I plucked a shirt from the rack in a Manhattan Urban Outfitters and went to find the dressing room. An outsized sign above a set of unisex stalls read: “All Gender Dressing Rooms.” It’s a bold stand to take, and one that suggests Urban Outfitters knows exactly who its customers are.
paragraphs.name: b8c2

paragraphs.text: By contrast, Pepsi’s ad offers up nothing about what the soda maker believes. And unlike Urban Outfitters, when Pepsi addressed criticism, it didn’t take a stand on police brutality and other political issues consumers raised. Instead, the brand apologized…to Kendall Jenner. Jenner, who has done no better than Pepsi in aligning her personal brand with a set of values, is reportedly in Paris recovering from the trauma of her big miss by avoiding social media. It’s a vacuous move that won’t soon be forgotten — if only because the memes are endless.
paragraphs.name: 93e7

a7b11a920270.title: This is what happens when ad agencies are given little or no leeway in helping a brand define…

paragraphs.text: This is what happens when ad agencies are given little or no leeway in helping a brand define themselves. I’m sure any digital agency worth the money Pepsi was paying — would have brought this up first. What do we stand for, what are we trying to communicate?
paragraphs.name: c3a6

b6e071da453.title: Pepsi’s ad was idiotic, tone-deaf, and, btw, weirdly color-coordinated (“Dude, we’re all gonna wear…

paragraphs.text: Pepsi’s ad was idiotic, tone-deaf, and, btw, weirdly color-coordinated (“Dude, we’re all gonna wear light blue!… Why?… I dunno”). Beyond being the butt of laughingstock memes now (deservingly so), years of previous social media work have gone up in fizzy bubbles.
paragraphs.name: 007f

virtuals.subtitle: But, to the point of another commenter kindly trying to “help” ;) at least Pepsi didn’t put out an ad featuring some attention whore…

content.subtitle: But, to the point of another commenter kindly trying to “help” ;) at least Pepsi didn’t put out an ad featuring some attention whore…

aa2c0c56ada2.title: First of all, who really cares about the message?

paragraphs.text: First of all, who really cares about the message? It’s a drink commercial for a beverage that causes more harm in America than almost anything.
paragraphs.name: 8f1d

paragraphs.text: Second, the message I got from it was that not all police are scum, or evil. Most of them are just doing their job and deserve respect like everyone else.
paragraphs.name: c05f

paragraphs.name: bd51

paragraphs.text: I assume that the Pepsi company believes the same thing as any of the companies you laud; in making as much money as possible by selling as much product as possible.
paragraphs.name: ede6

virtuals.subtitle: You accuse Pepsi of being vacuous for not jumping on every latest politically correct pity party that comes along in order to virtue signal…

c122af61182e.title: I agree with a lot of your points here, and it’s a pretty stupid commercial in general.

paragraphs.text: I agree with a lot of your points here, and it’s a pretty stupid commercial in general.
As head of editorial though, shouldn’t you get the NAME in the title byline correct?

ca650bec83e0.title: One more reason, following on a lifetime of them, that I have resolved long since to get the…

paragraphs.text: One more reason, following on a lifetime of them, that I have resolved long since to get the presence of any form of advertising out of my sensate experience whatsoever. I don’t do cable or satellite TV primarily because advertising on TV is an insult to the intelligence of a two-year-old, I don’t listen to commercial radio because its advertising is…
paragraphs.name: 08f1

virtuals.subtitle: The ad industry as a whole is a disgrace.

content.subtitle: The ad industry as a whole is a disgrace.

paragraphs.text: what was Pepsi thinking?
paragraphs.name: aceb

paragraphs.text: Making a great ad about people from all walks of live joining in together in a protest, Pepsi binding them together even with the people who control the crowd.
paragraphs.name: ed38

paragraphs.text: Yes, all beautiful people. Yes, they don’t really appear to be angry or even protesting. Yes, it shows America…
paragraphs.name: c281

virtuals.subtitle: Yes, all beautiful people. Yes, they don’t really appear to be angry or even protesting. Yes, it shows America shallowness as a caricature.

content.subtitle: Yes, all beautiful people. Yes, they don’t really appear to be angry or even protesting. Yes, it shows America shallowness as a caricature.

paragraphs.text: What a blunder. A bunch of pretty people. Fashionable clothing, great camera work, great lighting, but no message. The amount of dollars that Pepsi spends on advertising you’d think they could get it right. Trying to tag along on the real spot of a woman approaching the cop.
A serious lack of imagination. Looks like committee design. Empty with no purpose. You can’t fool the viewers.

virtuals.subtitle: A serious lack of imagination. Looks like committee design. Empty with no purpose. You can’t fool the viewers.

content.subtitle: A serious lack of imagination. Looks like committee design. Empty with no purpose. You can’t fool the viewers.

paragraphs.text: I’d be okay with the message if drinking – or being seen to be drinking – Pepsi could get this young demographic interested enough to actually show up, vote in large numbers, and take control of the country from us older folks…

fdf0f56cf261.title: There are plenty of peace signs so it’s presumably some sort of anti-war demonstration.

paragraphs.text: There are plenty of peace signs so it’s presumably some sort of anti-war demonstration. And the final moment of handing the police officer a Pepsi echoes the 60s demonstrations where people handed flowers to the officers.

932a6eabff3a.title: Ok. So if these police were beating the hell out of the protesters and if Miss (yes, I called her…

paragraphs.text: Ok. So if these police were beating the hell out of the protesters and if Miss (yes, I called her miss on purpose) Jenner in between blows gave the cop a remarkably unshaken Pepsi, then sure, let’s talk about police brutality. But these cops? They were just standing there. Not aggressively. No weapons drawn, no riot shields, no dogs, no helmets…
paragraphs.name: 71af
